review_title: Fantastic staff and Doctors Terrible management
pros: Patients, Staff and Doctors are fantastic. I stayed as long as I did because it was a great place. The people are good and top notch care.
cons: Patients, Staff and Doctors kept me there. Loved my job but management was a revolving door and they were all the same. Terrible. When there was a problem they would hide. They didn't do their job and take care of good staff. They used group punishment instead of reprimanding bad behavior. The work was lopsided and they would not fix it and ignore the problems. When we would ask for help because we follow the rules and have ethics and morals we are told to mind our own so it keeps happening. People call out constantly and I told the manager that if they don't fix it they were going to lose the good staff. Welp I was right. They would be great if they had good management to retain the staff they had. Underpaid by a lot.

review_title: Don't stay longer than 5 years, you will get burned.
pros: Some of the best physicians I have ever worked with in my career. Caring professionals, truly in medicine because they love it and the kids.
cons: The worst management I have ever been a part of. They don't care about their employees, especially the long term ones who grind day in and day out, go above and beyond and they kick them to the curb like they are trash. I saw it first hand three times already and it's truly saddening.  They hire interim managers who don't know what they are doing or how to  manage anyone, not even themselves and expect units to run smoothly.  No union, so no support if your having problems with anyone in authority above you.  They don't care and will let you go if you make any kind of report or ruffle any feathers.  Benefits are not special and either is sick leave. You max accrue and then they don't give anymore unless you use, not good business practice for a large corporation.

review_title: Great place to work. Bad leaders.
job_title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist in Orange, CA
pros: Lab is new, and small.
cons: Bad leaders. The pay is under average.

review_title: Repeatedly treated nurses as a throw away resource.
pros: Excellent nursing care.  The people closest to the patients truly embody the mission/vision/values.  Other pediatric services are fantastic, especially child life.
cons: Executive Management bred leaders who have completely lost their way.  They focused on ratings without ever noticing what was happening at the level of patient care.  These poorly envisioned leaders bought into expensive consultant "gimmicks" and unnatural slogans, without a deeper  understanding that staff was already providing amazing family centered care.  Dollar and illusory accolade driven, rather than interested in how their patients, families and employees "associates" truly feel about CHOC.

review_title: Great employees with the heart; CEO poor leadership and board mangement.
pros: Great employess can be seen in the halls with the passion for their work they do.
cons: How can a "non-profit" have a CEO making over 1.8 million and layoff staff to balance their budget and show the community this is the right way to run an organization?  This is the 3rd time under the CEO layoffs have been enacted.  Layoffs took place at the bedside where as the EMT & HR had very minimal if any.  The organization mentions change yet it seems to only take place at the bedside.

review_title: CHOC is mission driven, providing great care for kids and associates!
pros:
At CHOC our mission & values are front and center! 
We don't lose sight of who we are and what our potential is. To that end, CHOC recognizes how challenging the healthcare environment can be and is dedicated to taking care of their associates with enhanced benefits, education and wellness programs.  
CHOC really engages the right people at the right times, so exciting that we are including all levels of associates, leaders, physicians, patients & families in our growth plans. 
CHOC is dedicated to helping associates develop to their full potential.
CHOC's growing - we aren't just a hospital anymore! The opportunities to expand and develop your career far beyond a traditional hospital environment.
cons: CHOC's growing.  Sometimes ensuring that everyone is moving in the same direction can be hard. But this is something that CHOC remains focused on. It may not always be perfect, but CHOC is striving to stay the course.

review_title: Great hospital with a very disfunctional Human Resource Department
pros:
Many great HR individuals working on the front line to support managers and candidates
Focus is on hiring new associates who truly understand how to deliver exceptional care and supporting families
Hospital is well respected as a pediatric hospital
cons:
Consistently poor management and HR leadership
Excessive workloads and very bureaucratic
Recruiter role is very administrative leaving little time to truly source, recruit and hire
HR has a long history of excessive turnover, demanding workloads and weak management
HR doesn't have time to celebrate successes, create a rewarding work environment or make working enjoyable
No professional development or career path

pros: I love the mission, it's very rewarding working for a pediatric health system. There have been a lot of positive changes and organizational growth over the past few years, a lot more expansion coming. Career development is encouraged, usually easy to move up. Pay and benefits are competitive, free parking. I'm grateful they paid for a large portion of my advanced degree. Lots of autonomy and options to sit on committees/work on special projects. Challenging work, co-workers can rely on each other for help. Innovative organization that promotes growth and development.
cons: Growing rapidly, additional resources provided but hard for them to keep up with all required to support growth. Space capacity is an issue in a few areas but they have been working on acquiring more space.

pros: Everyone genuinely cares about one another and everyone believes in our mission and vision. Our leaders are invested and committed to supporting our growth within the organization. You feel heard and cared for. You are given the support you need, you just need to ask for it. Everyone is just nice! I thought it would wear off but it doesn't - no one yells or raises their voice. They value communication and respect so the interactions I have with everyone are always professional and pleasant. This is something that I am not used to from working at other organization so I don't take it for granted. CHOC spoils us with tons of training and education opportunities.
cons: There is always opportunity for improvement. Honestly, the only con I can think of is the coffee - we don't have enough of it. Work/Life balance could be better, but that's a personal decision because I love working for CHOC and sometimes forget to balance my personal life.

review_title: Best Co-Workers I have ever had, but probably the worst management
pros: Co-workers, equipment, facility, probably one of my favorite places to work. I truly enjoyed coming into work every day because I knew I was making a difference.
cons: Managers/Directors overstepped their boundaries, literally playing Russian Roulette with employee's lives. I was not properly oriented, and received nothing but false promises... GET EVERYTHING IN WRITING (lesson learned!).

review_title: 20+ years nursing care for all ages of children.
pros: The medical team and support crew are awesome people!!! I love my job for the young people I care for. But, the people I work along side by side are the most caring and compassionate group. These people are the ones that make CHOC what it is today.
cons: EMT's sure like to toot their own horn by giving themselves high rating. ARE YOU KIDDING!. This current CEO followed the same footsteps of the previous CEO. Pay BIG $$$ for a consulting firm to tell them how cut cost. Second round of lay-offs, then busy season comes and here comes OVERTIME pay. WOW big savings!!! And for a nonprofit organize, how does CEO make 1.8 million yearly when the budget is in the red!!! Too many EMTs that are paid big money, never see the patients or the people that provide superior care & service.

pros: Great mission.  Great healthcare practitioners.
cons:
One of the most dysfunctional organizations I've ever worked for.  Poor decision making.  Great facade of being a world class children's hospital.  Under the covers, processes, management, and technologies are far behind actual "world class" organizations.  Management is mostly comprised of lifers who are more concerned with CYA and politics than making quick informed decisions to improve the organization.  Culture allows for a majority of employees doing the bare minimum and leaning on the go-getters until they burn out and leave.

Very questionable ethics regarding CEO's compensation.  Poor performance should not equal top 10 percent CEO pay.  Poor performance and overall company management resulting in hundreds of people being laid off definitely should not result in the CEO receiving a $300k raise.  Seriously, $1.5 million a year wasn't enough??

review_title: A terrible management team that hides behind children.
job_title: Direct Patient Care Professional in Orange, CA
pros: The best bedside care.  The staff in direct patient care are 100% dedicated to their jobs and they support each other.
cons: The management team has a long standing history of picking out the weak:  great nurses and other staff that need to use the health insurance or care for a sick family member are laid off first: not by seniority.  The "expensive" staff: those with high retirement matching, those who have 100% legit short term medical leave or those about to earn the great retirement plan will be laid off as soon as Kim Cripe and Melanie Patterson gets word of these terrible things.  Heartless leaders who are completely disengaged from who their workers are.

review_title: Check future supervisor references before accepting a job in HR
job_title: Human Resources Employee in Orange, CA
pros: CHOC has absolutely the best clinical professionals around. I'm very fortunate to live in a community that has specialist like these to care for the children of Orange County.
cons: The reputation you create as a manager is critical with resources such as glassdoor, indeed reviews; rate my boss etc. now at the fingertips of future potential high performing employees.  The recruitment market is very competitive and expected to get worse with the retirement of baby boomers.  The high performing employee your organization desperately needs is not only researching the company but also their future supervisor.  It is very important to develop the managers in your organization that will manage to the culture your company wants to embrace. But more importantly is holding managers accountable who are not contributing to the company culture. Otherwise, the existing high performers will leave for better supervisors regardless of the company’s reputation, pay, benefits and future potential candidates will be working for the competitor.

review_title: You can really grow here IF you are willing to lead.
pros: People in the community are very proud of CHOC.  Doctors and nurses are compassionate and care deeply about patient satisfaction and service.  Management tries hard to keep its employees happy through good paid time-off benefits and competitive salary.  The people and culture here care about family.
cons: CHOC has a family atmosphere, but this seems to keep the workplaces stagnant and lacking in innovation or urgency.  Often, there seems to be a leadership void in various departments.  In other words, the culture is not very dynamic.

review_title: Job can be challenging but it's the best place I've worked!
pros: I love that CHOC continuously provides high-quality services to help our community. I work in the Human Resources Department. We have a great team. The leaders in my department encourage everyone on our team to learn and grow in our profession. Everyone on my team does a pretty great job of trying helping each other out as needed.
cons: My position can be challenging at times but that's one of the main reasons I enjoy working for CHOC. Since the workload is typically high in HR, I recommend our leadership continue to check-in with everyone on a regular basis to ensure we each have the tools/support needed to be successful in our roles.

pros: Caring for sick children, working with doctors & nurses who really care despite the poor leadership. Good location & new building.
cons:
The CEO & CFO did a terrible job planning budgets, now there are layoffs, but how come the CEO & CFO both have 2 assistants when some overworked departments are unable to have even one?  Cuts need to begin in administration, they need a reality check and and leave their sense of entitlement at home, this is a children's hospital not Hollywood. How about some compassion and caring from administration instead of their stuck-up attitude.  
The iCare principles and Mission are a joke, nothing but more misrepresentation & lies from administration.

review_title: CHOC is full of great people, but losing them fast, due to poor benefits, and lack of support from Executives
pros: CHOC as a fantastic place to work and the patients are phenominal to work with.  Staff is beyond awesome, but staff is being pushed out by terrible and costly benefits
cons: The health benefits are terrible.  The employees cost for the health benefits has increased (20-30%) each year, and the benefits are getting lower (higher copays and deductibles).  This year, the employee contibution rose over 30% and the companies contribution went down!  Plus, what slef respecting healhcare organization makes there employees pay a $1500 (that's right - Fifteen Hundred) deductible for a hospital admission (on an HMO)?  I'm pretty sure the Executive Team does not have this plan.  I'm pretty sure that they are provided free medical, that pays everything with no deductible or out of pocket.

pros: What a company! A very focused, mission-driven organization that is squarely committed to nurturing, advancing and protecting the heal and well-being of children. The leadership is not unreasonable. If you provide a solid business case, using data to support a business-driven decision, chances are they respect your recommendations. I feel valued and that my contributions matter. Good benefits, that continue to grow to meet associate’s needs. I really enjoy my coworkers and my manager continues to provide helpful coaching and feedback – which I appreciate!
cons: The vision for CHOC and its growth is AWESOME. However, decisions are not made lightly and therefore, seem to take a long time to enact.

pros: Great co-workers. Caring nurses who like what they do, but not the EMT (executive management team) that they do it for. If it were not for all my friends/co-workers I would be long gone.
cons: Getting in trouble for clocking out late, regardless to the reason. Not getting adequate breaks, but having to clock out for them to avoid getting into trouble later down the road. CHOC does not care about the personal lives of their employees. They take care of children, but couldn't care less if their own employees or their children are  ill. It's all a numbers game.

review_title: Tough times but moving in the right direction
pros: The mission, the people, the culture!! The leadership team is doing a great job in trying to constantly communicate updates, keep us informed, and even ask for our opinions on decisions. Not too common out there. The folks at the top, especially Kim, care about the people and are always trying to do what is best for everyone despite how hard it is to make some decisions. Thank you!
cons: Temporary, but the organization is going through some tough times

pros: The families you serve are the reason to come into work. That's what you are there for the kids who need you. BTW I take my kids because I know the nurses care.
cons: Management is wishy washy. They say one thing with their words, then do something different with their actions. This can be confusing for people who really love working here and serving the children in the community. Mass hiring, then lay-offs. It's horrendous, especially since this is supposed to be a desired place to work.

review_title: Another company with dysfunction. Passive Aggressive females.
pros: Not much I can say here.  Healthcare has really strange management. A lot of politics and fake managers.
cons: The creepy management staff are full of themselves. The predominantly female staff are typical passive aggressive, prima donna type women who act like they know it all, but they make so many mistakes. They know they got their jobs through nepotism. Don't trust these sneaky unattractive females. These women act like they are all that because they work at the Children's Hospital. They criticize other people when they are awful themselves. Typical bad corporate management. And as a general final comment, all upper management in all companies need to be drug tested. They people are crazy and full of garbage; money and positions with power are all corrupted.

pros: competitive pay, positive work environment overall, working with children, high-tech, beautiful facility, well-regarded by the community
cons: serious lack of diversity, doctors' unwillingness to provide translators, sexual assault and harassment in some departments without consequence to perpetrators or concern for victims

pros:
Our director and educator are good. Supervisors are weak.

NICU/PICU medical staff is good and will listen to staff.  PAs and NPs have a bit of a god-complex.
cons:
Upward mobility realistically only for RNs despite your background. Because of the number of RNs in management, RNs tend to be the only ones advanced.

Pay and benefits are mediocre

It is said they use "evidence based medicine" and in some cases that is true. A lot of the evidence is based on their own weak "research".

pros: colleagues,  patients, some of the physicians are great
cons: Firing and laying off staff every few years because the senior leadership team is not competent. The CEO, CFO, CMO, and VP Marketing have been there for over 20 years. THIS HOSPITAL NEEDS A NEW EXECUTIVE LEADERSHIP TEAM NOT MORE STAFF REDUCTIONS.

pros: Open access to CNO, Evidence-based practices, Competetive compensation, Positive environment and team
cons: Requirement for continuing one's education is not applied equally throughout the nursing staff, Educational reimbursement requires a lot of hoops to be jumped through with time constraints applied, Difficult to progress through clinical ladder due to excessive requirements/paperwork

pros: Taking care of the amazing and strong patients. Loved my job until management and staff turned on each other.
cons: Misstreatment by management, clicks people, some nurses and aids are lazy and rude, and they tend to look the other way depending on who or what you are. I know for a fact I’m not just talking one department. I totally agree with the previous reviewer on racism in the work place and I worked for them for 9 years. Believe me they have a lot of skeletons in their closets from Nursing to Security and Valet Services.

review_title: Great people, but ineffective leadership that promote a culture of silence, need to catch up with the times
pros: The people are very friendly overall, there are some politics like you would expect everywhere else, but most are generally good people. The frontline staff are absolutely amazing, and the support staff just as much so for the most part.
cons: Should clean house with management, there are many chiefs, directors and managers at the top that do not care about associates... they will make a big show over caring, but their actions say otherwise. I have so many emails that were just ignored. Lots of unqualified people get better positions with better pay, leading to high turnover. When something is brought up that management does not like, they will pretend to listen and actually sweep it under the rug. I have even been asked directly by managers to pretend I did not see a mistake, keep quiet about it, and to hide something from an auditor! People know to not say anything to management anymore because of that, it is a culture of silence. The technology at CHOC is also so terrible, the IT department takes years to respond to a ticket, which is just sad... CHOC is tiny compared to other companies The pay is well below industry standard, nearly every competitor I have researched pays so much more!!

review_title: Restucturing that did not make sense
job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Orange, CA
pros: Great benefits! Helping kids is a huge bonus! Great Dr's!
cons: Upper Management has no idea the problems that are on a day to day. They only look at numbers and how to cut back (in the wrong areas) and not the money that is being spent in the most ridiculous ways or on staff that can not perform.

pros: Reasonable work-life balance.  Opportunity to grow in knowledge of disease processes and patient care.  Employer is committed to ergonomics, safety and working together to be a better team.  Opportunity for short and long term disability insurance, health, dental and vision insurance as well as life insurance.  The company is going through Lean Six Sigma and Pyramid transformation.  It is a pruning time and will be followed by growth.  Management and physicians are learning to work more as a team.
cons: No concrete career growth opportunity for all positions.

pros: The culture is very welcoming to new employees, who feel supported by the resources and information available to them in CHOC's friendly environment. Professionally, there is a lot of opportunity for growth, as well as projects available where you can explore your interests while supporting the organization at the same time. Your past experience is valued and you're encouraged to bring your ideas to the table.
cons: At such a big organization, it can be easy to get physically turned around, but maps and people on campus are very helpful,

review_title: This is one of the most disfunctional places I have worked.
pros: I would take my child here any day. The doctos and nurses are amazing as is the facility. They do provide free parking and semi-fair salaries.
cons: Poor Senior Leadership - very unethical. There is no honesty and you often feel left behind on major decisions. They hire people based on who they know - not their experince in their field.

job_title: Clinical Nurse II in Orange, CA
pros:
- enjoy working with the kids
- all the fun events during the day for the patients and family 
- quick PTO accural
cons:
- toxic environment - specifically the floor I worked on, it was very cliquey, nurses talked bad about one another, teamwork is not consistent...
- Non competitive pay (new grads start $37 days, $7 differential for nights)

pros: Overall mission to take care of children.    Employee friendly place to work.   They are  striving for excellence.   I would recommend anyone considering working there.
cons: As all large organizations, it can take some time to bring about change.  The culture of holding on to employees even when they are under performing.

pros:
Great doctors and nurses, they really care about the patients

Patient care teams work well together, focus is on getting children better

Great mission
cons: CEO is indecisive and creates a lot of turmoil. It is easy to see that the management team lives in fear of her. All decisions must go through Kim Cripe. Causes delays in every decision. She has big public image and very little visibility in the hospital.

review_title: Toxic and hostile work environment.  Politics 24/7.
pros: It is very rewarding to assist clinicians improving the health of children.
cons: A complete lack of vision and strategy leads to passive aggressive behavior and bullying by management.  Office politics is most of the job here.  Incompetent or unqualified employees consistently push their work off onto their peers.  When complaints or requests for training are made, you are then targeted.  Empty platitudes like the "Voice of the People" program are completely ineffective when no action is taken to follow-up on the concerns raised by associates.

review_title: Leadership needs to be drastically Reorganized
pros: Good exposure to pediatrics, coworkers are awesome, they really care about your career advancement (mainly for the hospitals gain)
cons: Pay is below avg, 2/6 supervisors know how to actually lead, can be boring at times (even for overachievers who've already done everything there is to do plus more)

review_title: Mission-Driven Organization Dedicated to Patients and Employees
pros: Awesome mission and incredible leaders who have compassion for the organization and its people.  Top management, including CEO and COO, care deeply about making CHOC a destination hospital for patients and families, as well as physicians and employees.
cons: The hospital, like countless others locally and across the country, are experiencing tough time and working hard to make adjustments involving difficult decisions that will help the organization thrive in the new health care environment.

pros: The hospital itself is a great environment to work in. Everyone is really committed to their jobs and helping children in their community. The benefit package is also very and we have a lot of PTO.
cons: The institute does not put enough emphasis on their basic science research. Most employees outside of the research department don't even know what types of research CHOC is doing.

pros:
-This hospital really values the people it brings in. 
-Countless professionals
-appreciates in-house staff
- treats patients and families well
cons:
- Contracted employees are treated as second class citizens
- Hours aren’t achievable 
- Management is biased and does not listen to employee complaints
- Management needs to do better about toxic workplace culture
-Maybe this would help with worker moral

review_title: Great place to grow and care for children!
job_title: Continuing Medical Education Coordinator in Orange, CA
pros: CHOC has an incredible culture of care for patients, their families and associates.  CHOC fosters a positive, teamwork environment.  With the opening of the new tower in 2013, there are numerous clinical opportunities available.
cons: Because we are in a building phase, traffic is sometimes congested, plan your trip to CHOC 15 minutes earlier than scheduled appointment.  Associates should use the employee parking shuttle service and avoid crossing at the busy intersections.

pros: Great family / team atmosphere. I loved working for this hospital and would still be there if it wasn't for family care emergency.
cons: Pay is a little lower then I received in the past. Ratio and work flow on some units is a little much for the patient population in certain departments

pros: Better pay compared to other locations are similar positions. Great benefits, employer pays huge percentage.  7 mins grace period,  meaning your not considered late up to 7 mins. Working for a good cause
cons: Some management look down at you. Some can be very and unpleasant to work with. Very minimal increase If your not a dr or supv. No big company holiday  parties or bonus  unless your a dr/supv

pros: Orange County provides a great quality of life.
cons: Expansion of clinics and volumes occurs before equipment and staffing can support quality patient care and employee safety

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Orange, CA
pros: Helping children is the best cause anyone could work for.
cons: Extremely disfunctional.  The company is run by cronies of Kim Cripe, the CEO.  Discover her tactics or her surrogates and you're out.  Overworked and underpaid is the norm.  There is no personal satisfaction when you hear how much money goes to the CEO per year while overall company salaries average 1-2% increase per year if you're lucky.  This year the CEO's salary was $1,800,000, up from $1,500,000 last year!  That's an 8% increase or enough money to hire 4-5 more nurses!  What does she do for all that money?  She simply caresses the doners, accepts their donations, and plays politics with the Boards to keep her job.  I don't begrudge anyone for being successful but the CHOC employees don't even make industry wages and everyone in executive managment makes far more than industry standards!  The question must be asked; Why is CHOC looking for new workers while paying a consulting company a fee for three years advising them where to make personnel cuts?  This is for appearances only.  They are only replacing managment and technical personnel who have left or have been pushed out .  Don't think of working for this company unless you want your life to turn upside down.  The other negative comments on this site are truthful.  READ THEM CLOSELY!  The short positive comments are plants by the company; I know one of them and she is in management working closely with the CEO.  If I had researched the company's reputation in the community beforehand, I would never have gone to work for them.

pros: There are some pros to working at CHOC.  The doctors are very knowledgeable and working with SOME of the patients and families is enjoyable (the ones that really appreciate what you do for them and do not use and abuse the system).  A few of my co-workers have made the enviornment a nice place to work.  Had it not been for them and the dept. that I work for, I would have been long gone.  It would def. be a pro if I were a patient in this hospital, we do everything for these people.  I guess another pro would be that the entire time I have worked in this hospital, my office area has not been vacuumed once!  Sometimes the trash even gets left for days and you start having a wonderful aroma fill the air.
cons: Well, the first key to me that this place was dysfunctional would be the lack of training that I received when I was first hired.  First, you have the big hospital general orientation for the first week, then after that you are basically thrown to the wolves and it is do it yourself training (or DIY as some of us like to call it).  I know people that have been here for years and are still not doing processes correctly.  Secondly, these are the most back stabbing people I have ever worked with.  Definitely be careful of who you can trust, seriously, people will be running to your boss over any stupid little thing you say or do.  Thirdly, my manager is horrible.  I do not even know how this person has not gotten the boot yet--oh wait, yes I do, she kisses tail up the chain of command.  Meanwhile, she treats her direct reports like crap by belittling them in the staff meetings among misc. other things.  My best advice is, if you have a compaint about anything DO NOT be honest.  Just walk around nodding your head pretending like everything is all hunky dory with a smile on your face.  If you complain, it will backfire.  As I stated above, it is a joy getting to know SOME of the patients and families.  Others can take a hike!  We do everything for these people (literally just about anything) and a large majority of them are not grateful.  CHOC tolerates a lot of behavior that other children's hospitals in the southern CA area do not put up with (that's why they come here--all roads lead to CHOC)!  Lastly, my favorite thing is when other employyes of CHOC (normally the bigs wigs or 'CHOC cheerleaders') as I like to call them come to your staff meetings talking about how wonderful everything is and it is great to be a CHOC because of BIG changes occuring.  What they fail to mention is those BIG changes are layoffs, more backstabbing, and more grunt work for the peons!

pros: Caring and hardworking people who truly love the children and their families.
cons:
Upper Management/Management:  This is an organization that provides below market hourly pay for clerical or administrative staff including front/back office, receptionist, nursing staff.  They expect you to take mandatory courses after work hours or on weekends AND DO NOT PAY OVERTIME.  They also own SOCPA and micro-manage.  Overall, the HR management at SOCPA is a click all hired as friends years ago.  SOCPA was acquired by CHOC who also manages very POORLY.  The employees love the children and care about the families.  Unfortunately, CHOC does not care about their employees and is truly a business trying to make money and increase revenue at the expense of the children and by neglecting the employees..   

Regardless of the love and caring for our kids, it is a very stressful fast-paced work environment and employees are not compensated fairly.  They are understaffed and take months to fill positions as they become vacant.  They try to run SOCPA like a hospital and it is a physician’s office.  The annual hourly increases can be as low as .10 per hour!  The increase/cost of medical benefits surpass the amount of hourly rate increases every year.  HORRIBLE MEDICAL BENEFITS WITH HIGH CO-PAYS!  CHOC wants to keep their contribution to employee premiums low so the employees pay a lot even though they pay low on wages.  Selfish.

review_title: Loved working at CHOC as an RN
job_title: Registered Nurse in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: The team is what I loved the best about this company! We always had each other's backs in every situation. I hated leaving my coworkers.
cons: It was harder and harder for me to work with sick and injured children as time went on and after 7 years I got burned out.

pros: There is nothing positive to note.
cons: This hospital works its employees like they are slaves. I worked overtime every single day and the management was passive aggressive and allowed certain employees privileges that were not given to others.  The pay was not competitive and there is NO work life balance. Once you start don't ever expect a promotion or raise. It doesn't exist here.

pros: Salary was good, some of the staff were helpful and I had my own hours
cons: No training. they seemed to focus more on external customers and not internal. If you are not clinical do not get a job there.

review_title: Wonderful and supportive staff. Work as a team.
pros: Opportunities for clinical advancement and fosters positive teamwork environment. Management readily available. As an educational facility, there are many educational opportunities available.
cons: The hospital, like many others, is currently in a process of change. Adjustments are being made that will help the organization to grow and thrive.

pros: Upper management and doctors were accessible and easy to work with.
cons: Middle management was insecure in their position and tried to sabotage my job.

pros: Fun place and lots of activities for kids and personnel, paid vacation time is good, don’t have to work holidays, nice doctors
cons: A lot of work and responsibilities especially for one person, high stress, pay isn’t that great

pros: Cutting edge, positive coworkers, decent benefits (if benefitted).
cons: Certain departments have major HR issues, lack of diversity among staff.

review_title: Good and bad- just like any other job
pros: More good than bad!  Great place to work and so gratifying to work with the pediatric population.
cons: Hospital’s visions are awesome. The execution of of these visions could use some improvement.

job_title: Human Resources Manager in Orange, CA
pros: CHOC has a great culture and is a wonderful place to work.   People are friendly and open to new employees both in clinical and non clinical areas.
cons: So many worthy things to do.

pros: Beautiful Building. Some people there really want to make a difference
cons: Management out of touch with staff. Orientation unorganized. Negative nursing culture. Big Ego's. Terrible pay

pros: The kids we help and being in a children's hospital is the reason I stay working here. I love working and helping the families.
cons: Not appreciated. The administration is only concerned with promoting the hospital. They aren't very receptive to the concerns of the staff.

job_title: Assistant to the in Anaheim, CA
pros: The people at CHOC are very positive and make the atmosphere very nice to work in
cons: Communication between employees and management needs a lot of help

pros: Good cause, somewhat  flexible schedule.
cons: Bad management.  Cant make simple decisions.  Too many non workers.

pros: I get support with working on new and innovative way of performing my job and see that management is open for resources to move around and find better fit.
cons: Salaries are lower than the market.

pros: An exciting place to work, energetic staff, great teamwork
cons: I really don't have anything negative

review_title: Great Mission but TERRIBLE EXECUTIVE leadership
pros: CHOC has a great mission -helping children meet their fullest potential.
cons: The executive leadership is disconnected and does not have the capability to make the necessary changes CHOC needs to make.  Forget about the HR team; just as inept and untalented.

job_title: Leave of Absence Coordinator in Orange, CA
pros: Great lateral teammates, able to work from home at times,
cons: Unrealistic goals, no real support, work is pawned off to hourly employees, low paid, overworked

pros: I was a in middle management within the brand new laboratory in the new tower.  The support from upper management was fantastic and the commitment to the health and welfare of children was tremendous and demonstrated daily.
cons: The corporate culture is very conservative.  Suits and ties for all managers and above.

review_title: Overall compensation is not competitive. CEO is overpaid. Some departments feel neglected and underappreciated.
pros: Decent PTO and annual merit increases.
cons: Overall compensation is not competitive. CEO is overpaid. Some departments feel neglected and underappreciated.

pros: Great people, teamwork, and opportunities to learn! The people make this organization great.
cons: Lower pay, staffing issues, and so many organizational changes causing upset staff.

pros: Love taking care of kids and being there for families in their time of need. Good teamwork within individual units.
cons: Mass layoffs due to budget issues has left us short-staffed and without support.

pros: Good work life balance, strong executive management team, lot of growth attributed to the new tower for clinical and ancillary staff
cons: Nothing to share at this time

pros: Lots of perks, good pay
cons: Management hired on who they know, not experience

pros: Train in nicu and picu even for new grads
cons: They work you hard! Sick patients and many patients on your work load

pros: Everything they do for the kids
